speaker: HELENA
text_entry: SCENE II. Paris. The KING's palace.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Flourish of cornets. Enter the KING of France, with letters, and divers Attendants

speaker: KING
text_entry: The Florentines and Senoys are by the ears;

speaker: KING
text_entry: Have fought with equal fortune and continue

speaker: KING
text_entry: A braving war.

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: So 'tis reported, sir.

speaker: KING
text_entry: Nay, 'tis most credible; we here received it

speaker: KING
text_entry: A certainty, vouch'd from our cousin Austria,

speaker: KING
text_entry: With caution that the Florentine will move us

speaker: KING
text_entry: For speedy aid; wherein our dearest friend

speaker: KING
text_entry: Prejudicates the business and would seem

speaker: KING
text_entry: To have us make denial.

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: His love and wisdom,

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: Approved so to your majesty, may plead

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: For amplest credence.

speaker: KING
text_entry: He hath arm'd our answer,

speaker: KING
text_entry: And Florence is denied before he comes:

speaker: KING
text_entry: Yet, for our gentlemen that mean to see

speaker: KING
text_entry: The Tuscan service, freely have they leave

speaker: KING
text_entry: To stand on either part.

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: It well may serve

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: A nursery to our gentry, who are sick

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: For breathing and exploit.

speaker: KING
text_entry: What's he comes here?

speaker: KING
text_entry: Enter BERTRAM, LAFEU, and PAROLLES

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: It is the Count Rousillon, my good lord,

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: Young Bertram.

speaker: KING
text_entry: Youth, thou bear'st thy father's face;

speaker: KING
text_entry: Frank nature, rather curious than in haste,

speaker: KING
text_entry: Hath well composed thee. Thy father's moral parts

speaker: KING
text_entry: Mayst thou inherit too! Welcome to Paris.

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: My thanks and duty are your majesty's.

speaker: KING
text_entry: I would I had that corporal soundness now,

speaker: KING
text_entry: As when thy father and myself in friendship

speaker: KING
text_entry: First tried our soldiership! He did look far

speaker: KING
text_entry: Into the service of the time and was

speaker: KING
text_entry: Discipled of the bravest: he lasted long;

speaker: KING
text_entry: But on us both did haggish age steal on

speaker: KING
text_entry: And wore us out of act. It much repairs me

speaker: KING
text_entry: To talk of your good father. In his youth

speaker: KING
text_entry: He had the wit which I can well observe

speaker: KING
text_entry: To-day in our young lords; but they may jest

speaker: KING
text_entry: Till their own scorn return to them unnoted

speaker: KING
text_entry: Ere they can hide their levity in honour;

speaker: KING
text_entry: So like a courtier, contempt nor bitterness

speaker: KING
text_entry: Were in his pride or sharpness; if they were,

speaker: KING
text_entry: His equal had awaked them, and his honour,

speaker: KING
text_entry: Clock to itself, knew the true minute when

speaker: KING
text_entry: Exception bid him speak, and at this time

speaker: KING
text_entry: His tongue obey'd his hand: who were below him

speaker: KING
text_entry: He used as creatures of another place

speaker: KING
text_entry: And bow'd his eminent top to their low ranks,

speaker: KING
text_entry: Making them proud of his humility,

speaker: KING
text_entry: In their poor praise he humbled. Such a man

speaker: KING
text_entry: Might be a copy to these younger times;

speaker: KING
text_entry: Which, follow'd well, would demonstrate them now

speaker: KING
text_entry: But goers backward.

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: His good remembrance, sir,

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: Lies richer in your thoughts than on his tomb;

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: So in approof lives not his epitaph

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: As in your royal speech.

speaker: KING
text_entry: Would I were with him! He would always say--

speaker: KING
text_entry: Methinks I hear him now; his plausive words

speaker: KING
text_entry: He scatter'd not in ears, but grafted them,

speaker: KING
text_entry: To grow there and to bear,--'Let me not live,'--

speaker: KING
text_entry: This his good melancholy oft began,

speaker: KING
text_entry: On the catastrophe and heel of pastime,

speaker: KING
text_entry: When it was out,--'Let me not live,' quoth he,

speaker: KING
text_entry: 'After my flame lacks oil, to be the snuff

speaker: KING
text_entry: Of younger spirits, whose apprehensive senses

speaker: KING
text_entry: All but new things disdain; whose judgments are

speaker: KING
text_entry: Mere fathers of their garments; whose constancies

speaker: KING
text_entry: Expire before their fashions.' This he wish'd;

speaker: KING
text_entry: I after him do after him wish too,

speaker: KING
text_entry: Since I nor wax nor honey can bring home,

speaker: KING
text_entry: I quickly were dissolved from my hive,

speaker: KING
text_entry: To give some labourers room.

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: You are loved, sir:

speaker: Second Lord
text_entry: They that least lend it you shall lack you first.

speaker: KING
text_entry: I fill a place, I know't. How long is't, count,

speaker: KING
text_entry: Since the physician at your father's died?

speaker: KING
text_entry: He was much famed.

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: Some six months since, my lord.

speaker: KING
text_entry: If he were living, I would try him yet.

speaker: KING
text_entry: Lend me an arm; the rest have worn me out

speaker: KING
text_entry: With several applications; nature and sickness

speaker: KING
text_entry: Debate it at their leisure. Welcome, count;

speaker: KING
text_entry: My son's no dearer.

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: Thank your majesty.

speaker: BERTRAM
text_entry: Exeunt. Flourish
